Executive Summary


Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies


At Leggett & Platt, Inc, Iredell Fiber, Statesville, North Carolina.  We are committed to operating and maintaining all of our processes in a safe and responsible manner.  To ensure the safety of our
Employees and the public as well as protection of the environment.  We have in place an Accidental Release Prevention program and Emergency Response program.  This document will provide a brief overview and activities at our facility.

-A description of our facility and the use of substances regulated by EPA
-Overview of our Accident Release Prevention programs
-Five-year accident history for accidental release of regulated chemicals
-Overview of our Emergency Response program
-Planned improvements to prevent accidental chemical releases


Stationary Source and Regulated Substances


Iredell Fiber produces Bonded Urethane using a variety of chemicals for this process.  The facility is approximately 114,000 sq.ft. in area.  We are also located in a zoned industrial area.  Our process area is divided into two separate areas.  One being the process building housing the tank farm.  This area is fully enclosed by a dike.  The second process area is a separate building, fully contained, with it?s own processing procedures. In our processes, we use the following chemicals that EPA has identified as having the potential to cause significant offsite consequences in the event of a substantial accidental release: The regulated sudstance handled at this facility is Toluene Diisocyanate ( TDI, unspecified ismer).The maximum amount of TDI that can be stored at this facility is 27,436 pounds.
        
                       TOXICS ? Toluene Diisocyanate ( TDI, unspecified isomer )

        TOXICS ? Toluene Diisocyante
        FLAMMABLES ? None

Our accident release prevention programs and our contingency planning efforts help us effectively manage the hazards that are posed to our employees, the public, and the environ

ment by our use of these chemicals.


General Accidental Release Prevention Program


Iredell Fiber takes a systematic, proactive approach to preventing accidental releases of hazardous chemicals.  Our management systems address each of the key features of successful prevention programs including:
-Process Hazard Assessment
-Process Hazard Review
-Operating Procedures
-Training
-Compliance Audits
-Incident Investigation
-Employee Participation
-Hot Work Permit
-Contractors

As part of our prevention efforts, we have implemented the following chemical-specific prevention steps:

1.    Inventory Control of TDI
2.    Two-way communication during off-loading
3.    Never leaving off-loading area during an operation
4.    Standard Operating Procedures
5.    Preventative maintenance of TDI off-loading equipment

These individual elements of our prevention program work together to prevent accidental chemical releases.  Our company and our employees are committed to the standard that these management systems set for the way we do business, and we have specific accountabilities and controls to ensure that we are meeting our own high standards for accidental prevention.



Five-Year Accident History


Iredell Fiber keeps records for all significant accidental chemical release that occur at our facility.  The following is a brief summary of accidental chemical release involving materials covered under EPA?s RMP rule during the past five years.

    There has been no accidental release of any chemical at Iredell Fiber.


Emergency Response Program


Iredell Fiber maintains an integrated contingency plan, which consolidates all of the various federal, state and local regulatory requirements for emergency response planning.  Our program provides the essential planning and training for effectively protecting workers, the public, and the environment during emergency situations.  Furthermore, we coordinate our plan with the community emergency response plan.









Planned Changes to Improve Safety

The following is a list of improvements that we plan to implement at our facility to help prevent and/or better response to accidental chemical releases:

1.    Off-loading station:
a.    Air compressor dryer
b.    Dry-disconnect couplings and remote actuated emergency shut-off valve
